## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. 

```{r cars}
head(fertility)

fertility$purpose<- as.numeric(replace(german_credit_card$purpose,'','X'))[1:1000]
  
  german_credit_card$output <- gsub("good","1",german_credit_card$good_bad)
  german_credit_card$output <- gsub("bad","0",german_credit_card$good_bad)
  german_credit_card$output <- as.numeric(german_credit_card$good_bad)
  german_credit_card$output

summary(fertility)

```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE, warning = FALSE, message= FALSE}
library(plotly)
plot_ly(data = fertility, x = ~Sepal.Length, y = ~Sepal.Width,
        marker = list(size = 10,
                      color = 'rgba(255, 182, 193, .9)',
                      line = list(color = 'rgba(152, 0, 0, .8)', width = 2)))
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
